intro: Sicklera longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved sickler, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and elongated, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, white or pink, and clustered in dense spikes, often blooming in spring. Sicklera longifolia is often found in coastal or sandy soils and is adapted to tolerate salt spray and drought conditions.
